Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Conflict_Reason: Achieving 60 km/l fuel efficiency may require design choices that compromise braking system weight and performance, potentially hindering the effectiveness of ABS.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Conflict_Reason: Achieving high fuel efficiency (60 km/l) often requires design compromises that negatively impact top speed.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Seat height adjustable between 750-850 mm for rider comfort
Conflict_Reason: Achieving 60 km/l fuel efficiency may necessitate design choices that compromise rider comfort features like seat adjustability within the specified range.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Conflict_Reason: Achieving 60 km/l fuel efficiency in petrol engines may necessitate design choices that conflict with the added weight and power consumption of a digital dashboard with smartphone connectivity.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Front and rear disc brakes for reliable performance
Conflict_Reason: Achieving 60 km/l fuel efficiency may require design compromises that negatively impact braking system weight and performance, making it difficult to simultaneously implement high-performance front and rear disc brakes.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Conflict_Reason: Achieving high fuel efficiency (60 km/l) often requires advanced engine technology, increasing manufacturing and maintenance costs, potentially exceeding the $120 annual maintenance budget.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Achieving high fuel efficiency (60 km/l) often requires heavier components and technologies, conflicting with the lightweight frame requirement (under 150 kg).

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
